html_options_suspend_discard_after_suspe.message: Apply Chrome's built-in memory-saving when suspending
Reduces a suspended tab's memory usage even more, by utilizing
Chrome's built-in 'tab discarding' functionality. This can result in up
to 500% memory savings when working with large numbers of tabs.
However, it will also cause a slight rendering delay when selecting
For more information on Chrome discarding refer to:

html_options_suspend_screen_capturing_to.message: On a suspended tab, the extension can display an image preview of the what the tab
looked like just before it was suspended.
The screen capturing feature is experimental and can cause significant CPU usage as
well as slightly increased memory usage.
If you notice strange behaviour such as tabs taking a long time to suspend, or chrome
crashing unexpectedly, try turning this feature off.

html_options_suspend_force_screen_captur.message: Abilita la modalitÃ  di cattura dello schermo in alta qualitÃ
When disabled, screen captures have the following limitations to aid in performance:
- Cattura dello schermo di bassa qualitÃ
- Will not capture screen if it takes more than 1 minute to generate image
- Maximum height of screen capture limited to 5000px
Enabling high quality screen capture mode may significantly increase CPU load

html_options_other_enable_sync.message: Sync settings with your Chrome profile

html_options_other_enable_sync_warning.message: Turning this on will overwrite settings on all other browsers logged into the same Chrome profile

html_options_suspend_on_low_memory.message: Sospendi istantaneamente quando la memoria di sistema diventa molto bassa

html_options_suspend_on_low_memory_toolt.message: This option will override Chrome's automatic tab discarding functionality.
Se abilitata, forzerÃ  la sospensione di una scheda invece di essere scartata da Chrome.
Typically, Chrome will only discard tabs once system memory gets very low.
Please note: This may cause tabs to suspend earlier than the time you have
specified in the Automatic tab suspension options.
For more information on Chrome discarding refer to:
